title: What is the hybridization of carbon in CO3 2-? How do I find it? - Quora

response.answer_text: First we have to find the total electron pair of carbon, Total electron pair = 1/2[ V+M -C + A] V = total no of valence electron of atom under consideration M= total no. Of monovalent atom. C = total cationic charge. A = total anionic charge. Therefore, for carbon in CO3 2-, Total electron pair = 1/2[4+0–0+2] Total electron pair= 3 And for 3 electron pair , there exist “ sp2” hybridization.
Carbon is sp2 hybridised. Steric no=no. of atoms bonded to atom +no. of lone pairAnd steric no. is equal to hybridized orbitals. Steric no. for CO3 2- is 3. so,hybridisation is sp2.
